node.title: Olivia Rodrigo has ASL interpreter on Grammys red carpet
node.description: Several other attendees were seen with ASL interpreters too, including country star Mickey Guyton and singer-songwriter Elle King.
node.content: ["One week after \"CODA\" star Troy Kotsur became the first Deaf man to win an acting\u00a0Oscar, the Deaf community on Twitter was excited to see inclusivity at the\u00a0Grammys\u00a0when some of music's biggest stars were seen walking the red carpet with sign language interpreters.\u00a0", "Olivia Rodrigo won praise Sunday night \u2014 not only when the Disney star\u00a0took home Grammys\u00a0for Best New Artist, Best Pop Vocal Album, and an award for Best Pop Solo Performance \u2014 but when she was seen answering questions with an ASL interpreter at her side.\u00a0", "Rodrigo, whose debut album \"Sour\" premiered at #1 on the Billboard Hot 100 charts, was praised for the decision by Deaf artists including actress Marlee Matlin and musician Sean Forbes.\u00a0", "Thank you \u2066@oliviarodrigo\u2069 for having an ASL interpreter with you on the red carpet! You ROCK! \ud83e\udd1f\ud83c\udffc\ud83e\udd1f\ud83c\udffc #grammys #asl #accessability pic.twitter.com/4mKivtG6k9", "Thank you @oliviarodrigo for having an ASL interpreter with you, that was badass. Wish more would have had their interviews ASL accessible.", "\"We stan an inclusive queen,\" tweeted one fan, while another reminded\u00a0everyone that the Grammys should \"be accessible for Deaf viewers at home.\"", "Olivia Rodrigo bringing a sign language interpreter for her interviews \ud83d\ude2d\ud83d\ude2d we stan an inclusive queen #GRAMMYs", "OLIVIA RODRIGO AMONG OTHER GRAMMY NOMINEES REALLY HAD AN ASL INTERPRETER ACCOMPANY THEM & INTERPRET FOR THEM ON THE RED CARPET AS THEY DID INTERVIEWS SO IT COULD BE ACCESSIBLE FOR DEAF VIEWERS AT HOME. \ud83d\udc4f #GRAMMYs", "Love that #OliviaRodrigo has a sign language interpreter with her. #GRAMMYs pic.twitter.com/CbhAZfUw8i", "@oliviarodrigo won @RecordingAcad Best Pop Vocal Album #GRAMMYs  and rocked #RedCarpet with own ASL interpreter \u2764\ufe0fIf only @enews video was captioned \ud83e\udd26\u200d\u2640\ufe0f\ud83e\udd1f#CaptionsAreMyWheelchairRamp #DisabilityInclusion #OliviaRodrigo #DeafAndHardOfHearing #TobySportsGeekness #Accessibility https://t.co/kKRYAX4TSK", "There were other attendees seen with ASL interpreters too, including country star Mickey Guyton and singer-songwriter Elle King.", ".@IBM Watson tracked down so many interesting facts about Mickey Guyton in seconds. What #GRAMMYInsights have you learned? pic.twitter.com/qkrsYgMKn1", "I would love to see one entire ASL access stream from the #GRAMMYs  - it seems some of the artists had interpreters tag along with them... curious if there are other feeds/interviews with ASL interpreters TAG ME, I want to see!! @ElleKingMusic had one! pic.twitter.com/wAM034DKxW", "Michael Roppolo is a CBS News reporter. He covers a wide variety of topics, including science and technology, crime and justice, and disability rights."]
